instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.C1802: What is C1802? Capacitor to ground on PCH_SRTCRST_L on machines from 2009-2012, PCH_SRTCRST_L needs to be high for PCH to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
threads.message:
Liquid damaged dotted around the board

<CAPACITOR>C7526</CAPACITOR> & <CAPACITOR>C7525</CAPACITOR> we're burnt to a crisp when I got it replaced them and it cleared the short on that rail
Replaced ISL and ran a jumper from ISL pin28 to <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>. current sense resistors all measure ok.

G3h 12.59v

<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> checks out
L7260 600 ohms to gnd
L7220 600 ohms to gnd

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0v   - 4Mohms gnd

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
threads.message: <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> really 0V or you mean <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>? EN pin on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
threads.message:
yeah <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> is 0v i measured at <CAPACITOR>C7273</CAPACITOR>

<SIGNAL>P5VS3_ENTRIP</SIGNAL> is 0v
<SIGNAL>P3V3S5_ENTRIP</SIGNAL> 0.7v

edit: just measured <CAPACITOR>C7273</CAPACITOR> again and now seem to be getting a fluctuating value 1.3-5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> makes <SIGNAL>5V3V3_REG_EN</SIGNAL> and enables both 3v3 and 5V LDOs from <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>. So if both signals are there the LDOs should be working or <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> is dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
threads.message: <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> is now stable, replaced isl and still same symptoms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
threads.message: Why did you replace the ISL? Why is <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> stable now? If PPBUS is 12.6V then <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> should be present too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
threads.message: I mean 7200 sorry, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present and stable but still no <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking greenlight
threads.message: Check for short pulses on <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>, best to do with scope, multimeter are to slow. Also check 32KHz from clock chip and crap under SMC.
